modules.description: This module provides low-level operations for working with GMP multi-precision integers (`mpz_t`) via Ctypes, including initialization, assignment, conversion to and from Zarith's `Z.t`, and memory management. It directly handles `ptr` types representing GMP integer pointers and supports concrete use cases such as performing arbitrary-precision arithmetic in C-compatible contexts or interfacing with cryptographic libraries requiring `mpz_t` values. Functions like `of_z`, `to_z`, and `make` enable seamless integration of Zarith values with C-based GMP operations.

This module directly manages GMP rational numbers (`mpq_t`) through Ctypes, providing initialization, assignment, and conversion to and from Zarith's `Q.t` type. It includes functions to create, clear, and manipulate rational values via pointers, enabling precise memory control. Concrete use cases include interfacing with C libraries requiring `mpq_t` values and embedding GMP rationals in OCaml data structures with proper resource management.

This module implements low-level manipulation of GMP multi-precision integers and rational numbers using Ctypes, enabling direct interaction with C-based GMP libraries. It provides functions to initialize, convert, and manage `mpz_t` and `mpq_t` values via pointers, supporting precise arithmetic operations and memory handling. Use cases include cryptographic computations requiring `mpz_t` and exact rational arithmetic with `mpq_t` in mixed OCaml/C environments.
